pullRequest.title: Elasticsearch: Add withPassword(String) method for secure access
pullRequest.bodyText:
Instead of providing env settings manually, we can simplify the usage of Elasticsearch in the context of TestContainers by just asking a password.
Behind the scene, we do provide the needed env settings.
This PR comes after #2320 and should be probably rebased on master when 2320 will be merged.

beforeCommit.message:
Add withPassword(String) method to secure Elasticsearch

Instead of providing env settings manually, we can simplify the usage of Elasticsearch in the context of TestContainers by just asking a password.
Behind the scene, we do provide the needed env settings.

afterCommit.message:
Add withPassword(String) method to secure Elasticsearch

Instead of providing env settings manually, we can simplify the usage of Elasticsearch in the context of TestContainers by just asking a password.
Behind the scene, we do provide the needed env settings.

We also remove the deprecated usage of default ctor.

nodes.bodyText: Ideally we should get this from the Gradle definition. Is that possible?

beforeCommit.message: Make sure we close the RestClient at the end

afterCommit.message:
Add withPassword(String) method to secure Elasticsearch

Instead of providing env settings manually, we can simplify the usage of Elasticsearch in the context of TestContainers by just asking a password.
Behind the scene, we do provide the needed env settings.

We also check that we can not define the password on OSS image.
